thread.title: Why Taylor Swift is considering extended leave of absence
thread.title_full: Why Taylor Swift is considering extended leave of absence

author:
Compiled by Tony Hicks

thicks@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Why Taylor Swift is considering extended leave of absence
text:
Why Taylor Swift is considering extended leave of absence Compiled by Tony Hicks Posted: 10/08/2015 10:00:50 AM PDT Updated: 10/08/2015 10:06:29 AM PDT Taylor Swift says she might step away from the spotlight for a while. 
Great idea ... who's Taylor Swift? 
The "Wildest Dreams" singer, who is pretty much constantly in the news and on the cover of every magazine in existence, told NME in its new ... wait for it ... cover story that she is thinking about an extended vacation. 
"I think I should take some time off," the 25-year-old said. "I think people might need a break from me." 
N !!! 
OK, yes. Good thinking. Maybe she could take Justin Bieber with her. 
"I'm going to ... I don't know. Hang out with my friends. Write new music. Maybe not write new music. I don't know," she said. In this Aug. 30, 2015 photo, Taylor Swift arrives at the MTV Video Music Awards at the Microsoft Theater, in Los Angeles (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP, File) 
She might want to go to Oregon. I hear it's nice this time of year. Justin Bieber would probably love it. 
Swift also said when she does try following up the massive success of her "1989" album, she won't obsess with trying to outdo herself. 
"N . How could the next one be as big?" she asked. "Maybe the next album will be a bridge to somewhere else. Or maybe I'll just go ahead and change everything." 
She also talked about being so high profile. 
"I'm in the news every single day for multiple different reasons," she said. "And it can feel, at times, if you let your anxiety get the better of you, like everybody's waiting for you to really mess up -- and then you'll be done." 
That must be tough. Advertisement Tony Hicks writes celebrity commentary for the Bay Area News Group. Contact him at Facebook.com/BayAreaNewsGroup.TonyHicks or Twitter.com/tonyhicks67
